Alvord ISD Family:

We received a report of an incident at the bus stop near the Methodist Church this morning. An unknown female reportedly approached two students before the bus arrived. The students were not harmed, the parent of the students has been contacted and is aware of the situation.

This incident has been reported to the Wise County Sheriff’s Department, law enforcement and staff will be monitoring our bus stops. Thankfully the students reported the incident to a staff member, allowing us to investigate and address the issue. This serves as a reminder that we all need to be situationally aware at all times, parents may want to remind students to always be aware of their surroundings and to tell someone when something doesn’t seem right.

Dr. Randy Brown

Alvord ISD Superintendent

Beginning Tuesday, September 8th, all students will receive breakfast and lunch at no charge. Students will not enter their PIN numbers or scan their bar codes at the register unless they are purchasing additional items, this will significantly speed up the serving lines as we will just be making tally marks for the number of meals served to students.

Last week, USDA released flexibilities to ensure all children have access to nutritious food as the country recovers from the COVID-19 pandemic. Late Friday afternoon, TDA released guidance to school districts on how this could be implemented. We have opted into these waivers effective immediately. Free meals will continue until December 31, 2020, or until funding runs out.

We are pleased to announce the Alvord High School class of 2020 will be honored with an outdoor graduation ceremony!

The Texas Education Agency (TEA) confirmed today that we are allowed to have an in person, outdoor graduation as long as the local public health situation allows. Backup dates will be announced in case the number of active COVID-19 cases in Wise County changes the status of the approval from TEA.

The number of guests allowed to attend must be limited according to the size of the outdoor venue where the graduation is held. We could have the graduation ceremony at Bulldog Stadium on May 22. We could also have the graduation ceremony at a larger, nearby venue to allow more guests to attend. The graduating seniors will be sent a survey to determine the preferred location and date for the ceremony. The starting time for the ceremony and details including the plan to meet social distancing requirements will be available soon.

This is great news, we look forward to honoring our very deserving seniors!

Dr. Randy Brown
Superintendent
Alvord ISD
